maml:description.maml:para: Get context about the connected instance.

Get context about the connected instance. The context information is provided through Set-CAContext and is passed down to every requests to identify the URL to connect to and pass down necessary authorization headers.
Retrieve a page from the connected instance.
Retrieve a page from the connected instance. Return relevant information (Id, title, version, body, raw object,url, space)
Id of the document.
Omit the body of the document.
Omit the body of the document.
Id of the document.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return the document that have the corresponding ID.
Return the document that have the corresponding ID. Body is not returned

maml:description.maml:para: Get a table from a document body.
Get a table from a document body.
[CADocument] object obtained through `Get-CADocument`
Title of the table used to locate the table
Title tag. h2 is used by default. This correspond to the tag that surround the title (p,h1-h6,etc...)
[CADocument] object obtained through `Get-CADocument`
Title of the table used to locate the table
Title tag. h2 is used by default. This correspond to the tag that surround the title (p,h1-h6,etc...)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Doc = Get-CADocument -Id 1849330118 PS C:\> Get-CATable -Document $Doc -Title 'List of manufacturer by Country' -TitleTag h2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a table with a h2 title of "List of manufacturer by Country" from the document ($doc.Body). Table will only be fetched if it has the corresponding title, an optional info panel and the table itself.

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke-RestMethod wrapper to call confluence methods.
Invoke-RestMethod wrapper to call confluence methods using context to fill the gaps.
Specifies the method used for the web request.
Path to the resource of the web request.
Specifies the content type of the web request.
Specifies the headers of the web request. Enter a hash table or dictionary.
Specifies the body of the request.
Specifies the body of the request.
Specifies the content type of the web request.
Specifies the headers of the web request. Enter a hash table or dictionary.
Specifies the method used for the web request.
Path to the resource of the web request.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invoke Confluence API with some method. Authorization and base url is passed down contextually

maml:description.maml:para: Create an information panel.
Create an information panel.
Message to be displayed.
Message to be displayed.
Create a confluence table from an object.
Create a confluence table from an object.
Title of the table.
Tag of the table. This can be set to any valid html value (eg:h1-h6;p). Default is h2
Optional info panel to be put in between the table title and the table itself.
List of columns to be included in the table. Strings or CATableColumn objects (See New-CATableColumn) can be included
Object that will constitute the table. It should be a list of objects.
Define the header type. By default, only a Row header is used.
Confluence table style.
If $true, a numbered table will be created.
List of columns to be included in the table. Strings or CATableColumn objects (See New-CATableColumn) can be included
Define the header type. By default, only a Row header is used.
Optional info panel to be put in between the table title and the table itself.
If $true, a numbered table will be created.
Object that will constitute the table. It should be a list of objects.
Confluence table style.
Title of the table.
Tag of the table. This can be set to any valid html value (eg:h1-h6;p). Default is h2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new confluence table using the wide style with "List of manufacturers" title surrounded by a H1 tag (default is h2) along with a info panel. $ListOfObject will be iterated upon and each members will be added to the table. New-CATableColumn can be used to specify a different text for the header and a custom width.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a table column definition.

Create a table column definition. This is used to define which member of the passed down object will be used to build the table. New-CATable accept both strings and CaTableColumn object. This cmdled usefulness is when the object to be iterated need to have a different header text from the property name and / or additional options, such as custom width, need to be set.
Name of the property that will be iterated upon.
Header text for the corresponding property to be displayed.
Width of the column.
Name of the property that will be iterated upon.
Header text for the corresponding property to be displayed.
Width of the column.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Table = New-CATable -Style Wide -Columns @( New-CATableColumn -Name 'Word1' #-Width 48 New-CATableColumn -Name 'Word2' -Text 'Second word' -Width 100 'word3', 'word4' ) -Title 'List of manufacturers' -InfoMessage "This table was last generated $((Get-Date).ToLongDateString())" -Rows $ListOfObject -TitleTag h1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a column Word1 (since only the name is specified, it could have been defined as a string like word3 and word4) and a Word2 column that have a custom header text of "Second word" and a specific width of 100px.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the context used for connectivity to your Confluence instance.
Set the context used for connectivity to your Confluence instance. Any request made afterward will use the provided context to locate the resources and authorize the operations.

Credentials to connect to confluence. Username should be the email address and password the token generated from atlassian (https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens). This is not the user password.
Instance name of the workspace to connect to. This is the custom url part that represent your organization. (https://<InstanceName>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api)

Credentials to connect to confluence. Username should be the email address and password the token generated from atlassian (https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens). This is not the user password.
Instance name of the workspace to connect to. This is the custom url part that represent your organization. (https://<InstanceName>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ConfluenceCreds = Get-Secret -Vault Default -Name 'Confluence' # PSCredential object # Alternative without the secret management module # $ConfluenceCreds = [PsCredential]::new('U', (ConvertTo-SecureString 'SomeSecret' -AsPlainText -Force)) Set-CAContext -Credential $ConfluenceCreds -InstanceName 'Contoso'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example use the SecretManagement module to obtain a pscredential object containing the user confluence credential. This along with the instance name is used to create the context.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the body of the document to 'Hello world' and update the web document. The document must first be retrieved through Get-CADocument
Set the body of the document to 'Hello world' and update the web document. The document ID is used as a reference to the document to be updated thus it does not depend on Get-CADocument at all.

maml:description.maml:para: Update locally a table in a confluence document.

Update locally a table in a confluence document. This cmdlet does not publish the changes. For that, Set-CADocument must be used. The table format expected is a Title (surrounded by the title tag (h2 by default)) then optionally an information panel and the table itself.
CaDocument object obtained from Get-CADocument. The -ContextOnly switch should be avoided when this cmdlet is used since the document body need to be fetched in order to update the tables.
Title of the table to be replaced.
Tag surrounding the title (default is h2)
New content that will replace the original table.
CaDocument object obtained from Get-CADocument. The -ContextOnly switch should be avoided when this cmdlet is used since the document body need to be fetched in order to update the tables.
New content that will replace the original table.
Title of the table to be replaced.
Tag surrounding the title (default is h2)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Doc = Get-CADocument -Id 929823883 # $Table = New-CATable ... # $Table2 = New-CATable ... Update-CATable -Document $Doc -Title 'List of manufacturers' -NewContent $Table Update-CATable -Document $Doc -Title 'Order history' -NewContent $Table2 Set-CADocument -Document $Doc

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update 2 tables from the provided document with their replacement / updated table then publish the changes through Set-CADocument.
